Front (ES): A qué hora es la función
Back (EN): What time is the show?
Alternative: Asking about movie/theater showtime
Extra: Example: ¿A qué hora es la función de Spider-Man? → What time is the Spider-Man showing?

Back (EN): What time works for you?
Alternative: Polite availability question | 'Servir' = to suit/work for someone
Extra: Example: ¿A qué hora te sirve para almorzar? → What time works for you for lunch?

Back (EN): At what time? / What times?
Alternative: Used to ask about schedules or multiple times
Extra: Example: ¿A qué horas abren el banco? → At what times does the bank open?

Back (EN): Right now / This very moment
Alternative: Emphatic form of 'ahorita' (Colombian usage)
Extra: Example: Te llamo ahorita mismo → I'll call you right now

Back (EN): We'll talk then / Talk to you later
Alternative: Casual goodbye | Implies future conversation
Extra: Example: Bueno, ahí hablamos cuando llegues → Okay, we'll talk when you arrive

Back (EN): We're going / Let's go / Here we go
Alternative: Multiple uses: departure, progress, encouragement
Extra: Example: ¿Listos? Ahí vamos → Ready? Let's go

Back (EN): Let's have lunch together tomorrow
Alternative: Informal lunch invitation
Extra: Example: ¿Qué tal si almorzamos juntos mañana? → How about we have lunch together tomorrow?

Back (EN): The day before yesterday
Alternative: Contraction of 'antes de ayer' (common in Colombia)
Extra: Example: Antier fui al médico → I went to the doctor the day before yesterday

Back (EN): Let me know when you arrive
Alternative: Common safety/coordination phrase
Extra: Example: Avísame cuando llegues a casa para no preocuparme → Let me know when you get home so I don't worry

Back (EN): Bye we'll talk later
Alternative: Casual sign-off combining goodbye and future contact
Extra: Example: Tengo que salir, chao hablamos más tarde → I have to go, bye we'll talk later

Back (EN): When you feel better let's celebrate
Alternative: Caring expression postponing celebration until recovery
Extra: Example: Cuando te sientas bien celebremos tu cumpleaños → When you feel better let's celebrate your birthday

Back (EN): Whenever you want / You decide
Alternative: Flexible time arrangement showing deference
Extra: Example: Salimos cuando tú quieras → We'll leave whenever you want

Back (EN): How did today go? / How was your day?
Alternative: Standard greeting to ask about someone's day
Extra: Example: Hola amor, ¿cómo te fue hoy en el trabajo? → Hi love, how was work today?

Back (EN): How's the morning going?
Alternative: Mid-morning check-in phrase
Extra: Example: ¿Cómo va la mañana? ¿Muy ocupado? → How's the morning going? Very busy?

Back (EN): Rest we'll talk tomorrow
Alternative: Caring sign-off when someone is tired/busy
Extra: Example: Veo que estás cansada, descansa hablamos mañana → I see you're tired, rest we'll talk tomorrow

Back (EN): In a little while
Alternative: Colombian diminutive - vague timeframe (could be minutes to hours)
Extra: Example: En un ratico te llamo → I'll call you in a little while

Back (EN): Let's go in for a bit / Should we pop in for a moment?
Alternative: Suggesting a brief visit or stop
Extra: Example: ¿Entramos un ratico a saludar a tu mamá? → Should we pop in for a moment to say hi to your mom?

Back (EN): You're my favorite person today
Alternative: Playful/affectionate compliment for someone who helped/pleased you today
Extra: Example: Me trajiste café, eres mi persona favorita hoy → You brought me coffee, you're my favorite person today

Back (EN): We'll talk tomorrow calmly / Let's talk tomorrow when things are calmer
Alternative: Postponing discussion to avoid stress or rush (Colombian 'calmita' = calmly)
Extra: Example: Estás muy estresado, hablamos mañana con calmita → You're very stressed, let's talk tomorrow calmly

Back (EN): Today I'll pass better tomorrow / I'll stop by tomorrow instead
Alternative: Rescheduling visit to next day
Extra: Example: Tengo mucho trabajo, hoy paso mejor mañana → I have a lot of work, I'll stop by tomorrow instead

Back (EN): Tomorrow early / Tomorrow morning
Alternative: Specifying early morning timing
Extra: Example: Tengo cita mañana temprano → I have an appointment tomorrow morning

Back (EN): Let me know when you arrive
Alternative: Safety/coordination request - slightly softer than 'avísame'
Extra: Example: Me avisas cuando llegues a Bogotá → Let me know when you get to Bogotá

Back (EN): Tell me when you can / Fill me in when you get a chance
Alternative: Patient request for information without pressure
Extra: Example: Me cuentas cuando puedas qué pasó en la reunión → Tell me when you can what happened in the meeting

Back (EN): I love it when you kiss me
Alternative: Romantic/affectionate expression about timing of kisses
Extra: Example: Me encanta cuando me besas antes de dormir → I love it when you kiss me before sleeping

Front (ES): Me preocupo por ti avísame si te sientes
Back (EN): I worry about you let me know if you feel (unwell/bad)
Alternative: Caring expression requesting updates on health/wellbeing
Extra: Example: Me preocupo por ti avísame si te sientes mal → I worry about you let me know if you feel bad

Back (EN): A little later
Alternative: Colombian diminutive for 'más tarde' - softens the postponement
Extra: Example: Te llamo más tardecito → I'll call you a little later

Back (EN): We'll talk a little later
Alternative: Casual postponement with Colombian diminutive
Extra: Example: Ahora estoy ocupada, nos hablamos más tardecito → I'm busy now, we'll talk a little later

Back (EN): The day after tomorrow
Alternative: Standard expression for two days from now
Extra: Example: La reunión es pasado mañana → The meeting is the day after tomorrow

Back (EN): We can go for a bit / Can we go for a little while?
Alternative: Suggesting brief outing or visit (Colombian 'ratico')
Extra: Example: ¿Podemos ir un ratico al parque? → Can we go to the park for a bit?

Back (EN): Do you prefer tomorrow or Friday?
Alternative: Offering choice between two days for scheduling
Extra: Example: ¿Prefieres mañana o el viernes para cenar? → Do you prefer tomorrow or Friday for dinner?

Back (EN): Let's stay in touch / We'll keep in touch
Alternative: Expression of intent to maintain communication
Extra: Example: Fue un gusto conocerte, quedamos en contacto → It was nice meeting you, let's stay in touch

Back (EN): What's the plan for today?
Alternative: Casual inquiry about daily plans
Extra: Example: ¿Qué plan para hoy? ¿Nos vemos? → What's the plan for today? Should we meet?

Back (EN): We're going out today / Let's go out today
Alternative: Stating or suggesting going out today
Extra: Example: ¿Salimos hoy a comer? → Should we go out to eat today?

Back (EN): If you want I'll pick you up / I can pick you up if you'd like
Alternative: Polite offer to pick someone up
Extra: Example: Si quieres paso por ti a las 7 → If you want I'll pick you up at 7

Back (EN): I'll let you know when I leave
Alternative: Coordination phrase for timing/logistics
Extra: Example: Te aviso cuando salga de la oficina → I'll let you know when I leave the office

Front (ES): Te dolió cuando caíste del cielo
Back (EN): Did it hurt when you fell from heaven?
Alternative: Classic cheesy pickup line using past time reference
Extra: Example: (Flirting) ¿Te dolió cuando caíste del cielo? → Did it hurt when you fell from heaven?

Back (EN): I'll send it to you right now
Alternative: Promise to send something immediately (Colombian 'ahorita')
Extra: Example: ¿Me mandas la foto? Sí te la mando ahorita → Can you send me the photo? Yes I'll send it to you right now

Back (EN): You behaved well today / You did good today
Alternative: Playful/affectionate praise for someone's behavior today
Extra: Example: Me ayudaste mucho, te portaste bien hoy → You helped me a lot, you did good today

Front (ES): Te provoca un café más tarde
Back (EN): Do you feel like coffee later? / Does coffee sound good later?
Alternative: Colombian 'provocar' = to feel like/appeal to; casual invitation
Extra: Example: ¿Te provoca un café más tarde en el centro? → Does coffee sound good later downtown?

Back (EN): Does this work for you? / Is this okay for you?
Alternative: Checking if arrangement/time/way suits the person
Extra: Example: ¿Te sirve así o prefieres otro día? → Does this work for you or do you prefer another day?

Back (EN): Let's go walk for a bit
Alternative: Suggesting brief walk (Colombian 'ratico')
Extra: Example: Hace buen clima, vamos a caminar un ratico → The weather's nice, let's go walk for a bit

Front (ES): Vamos a la barra un momento
Back (EN): Let's go to the bar for a moment
Alternative: Suggesting brief stop at bar/counter
Extra: Example: Vamos a la barra un momento a pedir otra cerveza → Let's go to the bar for a moment to order another beer

Back (EN): Let's go to the beach tomorrow
Alternative: Making plans for beach tomorrow
Extra: Example: ¿Vamos a la playa mañana? El clima va a estar perfecto → Let's go to the beach tomorrow? The weather will be perfect

Back (EN): Almost there / Almost done
Alternative: Indicating near completion or arrival
Extra: Example: ¿Ya terminaste? Ya casi → Are you done yet? Almost there

Back (EN): I'm almost there
Alternative: Arrival announcement when close
Extra: Example: ¿Dónde estás? Ya casi llego, dos minutos → Where are you? I'm almost there, two minutes

Back (EN): You arrived (already) / Did you arrive?
Alternative: Question or confirmation of arrival
Extra: Example: ¿Ya llegaste a tu casa? → Did you arrive at your house?

Back (EN): I just arrived / I'm here now
Alternative: Announcement of arrival
Extra: Example: Ya llegué al restaurante, ¿dónde estás? → I just arrived at the restaurant, where are you?
